summary: Compilation of Skyrim.ini and SkyrimPrefs.ini tweaks and other useful hints and tips for The Elder Scrolls: V - Skyrim.
descriptionHtml:
[center]Â [img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655064.png[/img][/center]
[center][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=5][u][i]A [/i][/u][u][i]compilation[/i][/u][u][i] of[/i][/u][u][i] various[/i][/u][u][i] .ini's[/i][/u][u][i] for[/i][/u][u][i] Skyrim[/i][/u][i]... [/i][u][i]and[/i][/u][u][i] other[/i][/u][u][i] things[/i][/u][i]![/i][/size][/color][/font][u][i][font=Times New Roman][size=4][/size][/font][/i][/u][/center][u][i][font=Times New Roman][size=4]

[/size][/font][/i][/u]
[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655069.png[/img]

[list]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]First of all, this is a "lightweight" guide, so you don't need to dive into these large guides. Use this guide if you only want a "quick approach" to the modding world;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]This is a compilation of various .inis for Skyrim that I found safe to use;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]This is a guide to make your Skyrim safe and stable;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]This is not a "mod", this is a list of tweaks for Skyrim.ini and SkyrimPrefs.ini and other useful hints, so you don't need to download anything (and you shouldn't as the Description page is better), unless you want to endorse and vote the guide.[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]If you feel that "this" or "that" part of the guide is useless, outdated or unneeded, you can safely jump it.[/size][/color][/font]
[/list][img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655073.png[/img]

[list]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]You must open the Skyrim.ini and SkyrimPrefs.ini inside the My Games folder in the Documents, and edit using this list.[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]The best way to use it is editing with Notepad++ [size=4]free [/size]software (search in google);[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]I made the guide to be very dynamic, and without the need to follow an "order", if you wish, you can jump to the bottom of the guide![/size][/color][/font]
[/list][img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655078.png[/img]

[list]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]Even if you have the best Skyrim visuals and the most sable modded game, you must at least tweak some settings;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]If you are unsatisfied with the visuals of the water, shadows, grass, fps or another thing, you can tweak in the .ini's;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]The guide is friendly to users with both "low hardware" and "high-end hardware".[/size][/color][/font]
[/list][img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655250.png[/img]

[list=1]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][color=#ffff00]YELLOW[/color]: It says where to put the .ini tweaks;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][color=#00ff00]GREEN[/color]: It says what the .ini tweak is and what it do;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][color=#1e84cc]BLUE[/color]: The .ini itself;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][color=#ffffff]WHITE[/color]: The value of the .ini;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]GRAY: The official collor for Writing the texts.[/size][/color][/font]
[/list][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=1]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/size][/color][/font]

[center]
[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655095.png[/img][/center]


[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655096.png[/img]
[font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ffff00] [/color][/font][size=2][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ffff00][size=3]"All changes must be done to the Skyrim Prefs.ini in the[/size][/color][/font][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ffff00][size=4][i][Display][/i][/size][/color][/font][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ffff00] category."[/color][/font][font=Arial]


[/font][/size][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]iShadowMapResolution[/color]=2048 [color=#00ff00](Size of ENTIRE memory-pool used for shadow-texture distribution on surfaces, increase it to 4096 if you have a good gaming rig.)[/color][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]iShadowMapResolutionPrimary[/color]=1024 [color=#00ff00](Size of memory-pool used for primary shadow LOD-textures on surfaces BEFORE the "iBlurDeferredShadowMask" range, increase it to get a more detailed shadow close to the borders.)[/color][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]iShadowMapResolutionSecondary[/color]=1024 [color=#00ff00](Size of memory-pool used for secondary shadow LOD-textures on surfaces PAST the "iBlurDeferredShadowMask" range nearly the same as above.)[/color][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]fShadowBiasScale[/color]=0.6000 [color=#00ff00](The ANGLE the Shadow-maps are aligned to surfaces. Anything from 0.3 - 0.6 is recommended, but you can put [font=Arial][size=2]1.0000, so that you don't see shadows "loading" while you pass close to them[/size][/font])[/color][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]iShadowMaskQuarter[/color]=3 [color=#00ff00](How many Quarters of an object are being visually aligned to the players viewpoint. 3 = 75% standard, 4 is FULL. No need for more because 4 = 100% coverage)[/color][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]iBlurDeferredShadowMask[/color]=10 [color=#00ff00](The amount of blurring added to shadow-edges. 0=Sharpest with ZERO blurring, making shadows very choppy. 5 is standard. A value of 10 is[/color][/size][/font][font=Arial][size=2][color=#00ff00] recommend[/color][/size][/font][font=Arial][size=2][color=#00ff00] so that shadows seen up-close are still 'soft' around the edges, if you find it too blurry, decrease it to 5 or 3.)[/color][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]fShadowDistance[/color]=3500.0000[color=#00ff00] (Distance of shadow-maps displayed to the player, highly recommended values are; 2000=Low, 3000=Medium, 4000=MAX, but no higher since you lose quality the further away shadows are drawn, and most of the landscape of Skyrim was designed with hills and other surfaces to 'mask' these shadow-transitions.)[/color][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]fInteriorShadowDistance[/color]=8000.0000 [color=#00ff00](This value determines the distance to player that lights are displayed to DRAW shadows, if this value is below 8000, then players will see lights flashing on & off in dungeons and other interiors. Changing this value to smaller numbers does NOT improve shadow-quality, this is strictly a light-draw-distance factor.)[/color][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]iShadowFilter[/color]=3[color=#00ff00] (Recommended value of 3, since 4 causes 'Crash To Desktop' on some machines)[/color][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]fShadowLODStartFade[/color]=200.0000 [color=#00ff00](This is the number that changes the quality of a shadows appearance up-close, the smaller the number, the better the resolution. It's best to be set at 200, since 100 is too short a range and doesn't start drawing for the players point-of-view until 200.)[/color][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]iShadowMode[/color]=3 [color=#00ff00](Recommended value of 3, since 4 is buggy in some areas, particularly around waterfalls which will be either too-bright or too dark)[/color][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]bTreesReceiveShadows[/color]=1 [color=#00ff00](Shadows on Trees)[/color][/size][/font]
[/list][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]bDrawLandShadows[/color]=1 [color=#00ff00](Shadows on Land)[/color][/size][/font]
[/list][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]bDrawShadows[/color]=1 [color=#00ff00](Shadows itself)[/color][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2][color=#1e84cc]bShadowMaskZPrepass[/color]=0 [color=#00ff00](This prepass ensures the active blending of shadows onto textured surfaces and is used to handle the value of 'iShadowMaskQuarter'' with the game-engine. It is not required, but DOES add realism if you have a good machine)[/color][/size][/font]
[/list]
[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655106.png[/img]
[color=#ffff00] [/color][size=2][color=#ffff00][size=3][font=Comic Sans MS]"These changes are to be made only to Skyrim.ini file."[/font]
[/size][/color]
[font=Arial][color=#b6b6b6][Archive][/color][/font][font=Arial]
[color=#1e84cc]sResourceArchiveList[/color]=Skyrim - Misc.bsa, Skyrim - Shaders.bsa, Skyrim - Textures.bsa, Skyrim - Interface.bsa, Skyrim - Animations.bsa, Skyrim - Meshes.bsa, Skyrim - Sounds.bsa
[color=#1e84cc]sResourceArchiveList2[/color]=Skyrim - Voices.bsa, Skyrim - VoicesExtra.bsa
[color=#ffff00][color=#00ff00](Theses corrects some sound bugs and fixes too the "Esbern-no-voice" bug)[/color]
[/color]
[color=#b6b6b6][Display][/color]
[color=#1e84cc]fSunShadowUpdateTime[/color]=0.25 [color=#00ff00](Set the speed in wich the shadows move each hour (sun>shadow>Shadow localization)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]fSunUpdateThreshold[/color]=1.5[color=#00ff00](same as above with some diferences)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]iPresentInterval[/color]=1 [color=#00ff00](V-Sync enabled, put it to 0 to disable.)[/color]

[color=#b6b6b6][General][/color]
[color=#1e84cc]fFlickeringLightDistance[/color]=8192 [color=#00ff00](prevent lighting pop-in)[/color]

[color=#b6b6b6][Grass][/color] [color=#00ff00](Render grass on long (not too long) distances), can cut 5 or more FPS on low cpu machines)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]fGrassFadeRange[/color]=10000
[color=#1e84cc]iMaxGrassTypesPerTexure[/color]=3
[color=#1e84cc]iMinGrassSize[/color]=40

[color=#b6b6b6][MapMenu][/color] [color=#00ff00](Free camera to world map and 360Âº turning)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]fMapWorldYawRange[/color]=400
[color=#1e84cc]fMapWorldMinPitch[/color]=0
[color=#1e84cc]fMapWorldMaxPitch[/color]=90[/font]

[size=3]Â Â Â  [font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ffff00] "These changes are to be made only to Skyrim Prefs.ini file."[/color][/font][/size]

[font=Arial][color=#b6b6b6][Display][/color][/font][font=Arial]
[color=#1e84cc]bFloatPointRenderTarget[/color]=0 [color=#00ff00](Enable this one if you have ENB, don't need to enable on ENBoost.)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bDeferredShadows[/color]=1 [color=#00ff00](turn off if you don't care about shadows quality or want fps boost while having a high shadows settings)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bDrawLandShadows[/color]=1 [color=#00ff00](Shadows on land)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bShadowsOnGrass[/color]=1 [color=#00ff00](Shadows on Grass)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bTreesReceiveShadows[/color]=1 [color=#00ff00](Shadows on Trees)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]iShadowFilter[/color]=3
[color=#1e84cc]bShadowMaskZPrepass[/color]=0
[color=#1e84cc]fMeshLODLevel1FadeTreeDistance[/color]=6144 [color=#00ff00](This almost entirely removes tree popping)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]fMeshLODLevel2FadeTreeDistance[/color]=4096 [color=#00ff00](Same as above)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]fTreesMidLODSwitchDist[/color]=8192 [color=#00ff00](Help the two above with the same objective)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]iMaxDecalsPerFrame[/color]=250 [color=#00ff00](The amount of decals (effects like when you cast "flames" on the floor) to appear)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]iMaxSkinDecalsPerFrame[/color]=100

[color=#b6b6b6][Launcher][/color] [color=#00ff00](Enables selection of mods through the launcher (not recomended to use it, but if not enabled, when you arrange the load order by eg.: NMM, and use the launcher, all of the plugins will be disabled, so you have to reenable it) [/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bEnableFileSelection[/color]=1

[color=#b6b6b6][Trees][/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bRenderSkinnedTrees[/color]=0 [size=2][font=Arial][color=#00ff00](This entirely removes the unskinned trees (lusher trees), giving a good fps boost and removing trees popping (100% sure).)[/color][/font][/size]
[color=#1e84cc]uiMaxSkinnedTreesToRender[/color]=200

[color=#b6b6b6][Water][/color] [color=#00ff00](Reflection resolution of the water (with or without mods), you should leave at least with 1024 both)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]iWaterReflectHeight[/color]=1024
[color=#1e84cc]iWaterReflectWidth[/color]=1024
[/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ffff00] [size=3]"While the following INI tweaks may not be "recommended," they can be useful(in Skyrim.ini only)."[/size][/color][/font]

[font=Arial][color=#b6b6b6][Display][/color][/font][font=Arial] [color=#00ff00](The [i]field of view[/i] is the extent of the observable world that is seen at any given moment, some FOV configuration can make Shadows better or worse, try testing all the FOV from 100 to 60 to see the best results.)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]fDefault1stPersonFOV[/color]=81 [color=#00ff00](this is the FOV in first person.)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]fDefaultFOV[/color]=81
[color=#1e84cc]fDefaultWorldFOV[/color]=81
[/font][/size][font=Arial][color=#00ff00](The configuration depends on the game resolution, the above is mine, but the most recomended is the default, in that case, these lines shouldnt exist)[/color][/font]
[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655117.png[/img]
[size=2][size=3] [font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ffff00] "These changes are to be made only to Skyrim.ini file."[/color][/font][/size]

[/size][list]
[*][size=2][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3] Some people claims that Skyrim [color=#1e84cc]multithreading[/color] is unstable or it dosen't work, I recommend youÂ  to [color=#1e84cc]test[/color] the game [color=#1e84cc]without, and then, with[/color]... If your game is more stable than before (without 30 minutes with stability and then CTD), then happy multithreaded game, otherwise sorry! (Oh, always make a backup of your .ini's and savegames.)[/size][/color][/font][/size]
[*][size=2][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]For a better multithreading sistem, use ENBoost, use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/73618/]Crash fix ENBoost[/url]. There are instructions there.[/size][/color][/font][/size]
[/list][size=2]
[font=Arial][color=#00ff00]([/color][/font][font=Arial][color=#00ff00]In computer architecture, [b]multithreading[/b] is the ability of a CPU or a single core in a multi-core processor to execute multiple processes or threads concurrently, appropriately supported by the operating sistem.)[/color]

[color=#b6b6b6][BackgroundLoad][/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bBackgroundLoadLipFiles[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bLoadBackgroundFaceGen[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseMultiThreadedFaceGen[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bBackgroundCellLoads[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bLoadHelmetsInBackground[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseMultiThreadedTrees[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseBackgroundFileLoader[/color]=1

[color=#b6b6b6][Animation][/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bMultiThreadBoneUpdate[/color]=1

[color=#b6b6b6][HAVOK][/color] [color=#00ff00](Here you put the NUMBER of cores your CPU has in the "X", put on the maximum of 4 (even if you have more) and the minimum of 1[/color])
[color=#1e84cc]iNumThreads[/color]=X
[font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6](I remember another tweak that is very close to this one where you put the number of cores your CPU has, this other tweak is unstable and WILL make your computer melt, use this one instead, "[color=#1e84cc]iNumThreads[/color][color=#ffffff]=X[/color]" (above))[/color][/font]

[color=#b6b6b6][General][/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bUseThreadedTempEffects[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseThreadedParticleSystem[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bMultiThreadMovement[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseThreadedMorpher[/color]=1

[color=#b6b6b6][Decals][/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bDecalMultithreaded[/color]=1[/font]

[size=3] [color=#ffff00] [font=Comic Sans MS]"These changes are to be made only to Skyrim Prefs.ini file."[/font][/color][/size]

[font=Arial][color=#b6b6b6][Navmesh][/color][/font][font=Arial]
[color=#1e84cc]bUseThreadedMeshes[/color]=1

[color=#b6b6b6][Trees][/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bUseMultiThreadedTrees[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bShadowMaskZPrePass[/color]=1
[color=#b6b6b6]
[BackgroundLoad][/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bBackgroundLoadLipFiles[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bLoadBackgroundFaceGen[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseMultiThreadedFaceGen[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bBackgroundCellLoads[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bLoadHelmetsInBackground[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseMultiThreadedTrees[/color]=1

[color=#b6b6b6][General][/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bUseThreadedParticleSystem[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseThreadedBlood[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseThreadedMorpher[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseThreadedTempEffects[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseThreadedTextures[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseThreadedMeshes[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseThreadedLOD[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseThreadedAI[/color]=1
[color=#1e84cc]bUseThreadedMorpher[/color]=1

[color=#b6b6b6][Decals][/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bDecalMultithreaded[/color]=1
[/font]
[/size]
[size=2][img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655129.png[/img][/size]
[size=2][size=3] [font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ffff00] "These changes are to be made only to Skyrim.ini file."[/color][/font][/size]


[font=Arial][color=#b6b6b6][Combat][/color][/font][font=Arial] [color=#00ff00](Arrows can be forced to shoot through the center point...)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]fMagnetismStrafeHeadingMult[/color]=0.0
[color=#1e84cc]fMagnetismLookingMult[/color]=0.0
[color=#1e84cc]f1PArrowTiltUpAngle[/color]=0.7
[color=#1e84cc]f3PArrowTiltUpAngle[/color]=0.7
[color=#1e84cc]f1PBoltTiltUpAngle[/color]=0.7
[color=#1e84cc]f3PBoltTiltUpAngle[/color]=0.7

[color=#b6b6b6][Actor] [/color][color=#00ff00](...[size=2]and be allowed to hit targets with as far as the arrow can fly, rather than passing through targets (without causing damage) at long distances)[/size][/color]
[color=#1e84cc]fVisibleNavmeshMoveDist[/color]=12288.0000
[/font]
[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655132.png[/img]
[size=3] [color=#ffff00] [font=Comic Sans MS]"These changes are to be made only to Skyrim.ini file."[/font][/color][/size]

[/size][list]
[*][size=2][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]Some people claims that this tweak (papyrus) dosen't work or is unstable to tweak, I recommend, like the multithreading tweaks, to test the game without, and then, with the "heavy version"... If your game is more stable than before (without 30 minutes with stability and then CTD), then be happy, otherwise, use the "more stable" version, instead, and if you still can't tweak this setting or are unsure if you should be tweaking papyrus, use the "even more stable" version, and if you still can't tweak it, you SHOULD completly delete it, so the game will use the defaut values.[/size][/color][/font][/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][font=Arial][color=#00ff00](You should only put this if you have scripted mods installed, or more than 70 mods.)[/color][/font][/size]
[/list][size=2][font=Arial][color=#00ff00]
[/color][/font][/size]
[size=2][size=2][font=Arial][color=#00ff00](This is the "heavy version")[/color][/font][/size]
[font=Arial][color=#b6b6b6][Papyrus][/color][/font][font=Arial]
[color=#1e84cc]fUpdateBudgetMS[/color]=800.0
[color=#1e84cc]fExtraTaskletBudgetMS[/color]=800.0
[color=#1e84cc]fPostLoadUpdateTimeMS[/color]=2000.0
[color=#1e84cc]iMinMemoryPageSize[/color]=256
[color=#1e84cc]iMaxMemoryPageSize[/color]=512
[color=#1e84cc]iMaxAllocatedMemoryBytes[/color]=153600[/font]

[size=2][size=2][font=Arial][color=#00ff00](This is the "more stable version")[/color][/font][/size][/size]
[font=Arial][color=#1e84cc][color=#b6b6b6][Papyrus] [/color]
fUpdateBudgetMS[color=#ffffff]=20.0[/color]
fExtraTaskletBudgetMS[color=#ffffff]=20.0[/color]
fPostLoadUpdateTimeMS[color=#ffffff]=500.0[/color]
iMinMemoryPageSize[color=#ffffff]=128[/color]
iMaxMemoryPageSize[color=#ffffff]=512[/color]
iMaxAllocatedMemoryBytes[color=#ffffff]=76800[/color][/color][/font]

[size=2][size=2][size=2][font=Arial][color=#00ff00](If you're still unsure to tweak papyrus, this is the "even more stable version", it only allows more time for Papyrus scripts to execute when loading a new area, it WILL minimizes errors caused by scripts not finishing before the allotted time has expired.)[/color][/font][/size][/size][/size]
[font=Arial][color=#b6b6b6][Papyrus][/color]
[color=#1e84cc]fPostLoadUpdateTimeMS[/color]=2000.0
[/font]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6]For more information on the "papyrus section", go to [url=http://www.creationkit.com/INI_Settings_%28Papyrus%29]Read INI Settings (Papyrus) - Creation Kit[/url].[/color][/font][/size]
[/list][size=2]
[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655133.png[/img]
[size=3] [font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ffff00] "These changes are to be made only to Skyrim.ini file on the General section (if not already made)"[/color][/font][/size]

[font=Arial][color=#b6b6b6][General][/color][/font][font=Arial] [color=#00ff00](This disables the invisible borders, so you can go to Cyrodill, Morrowind or Atmora, there is a recommended mod to use with this tweak later.)[/color]
[color=#1e84cc]bBorderRegionsEnabled[/color]=0[/font]

[/size][img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655248.png[/img]
[size=2][size=3][color=#ffff00] [font=Comic Sans MS] "These changes are to be made only to Skyrim.ini file"[/font]
[/color][/size][/size][font=Arial][color=#b6b6b6][General][/color]
[color=#1e84cc]sIntroSequence[/color]=Â  [size=2][color=#00ff00](This must be left in "blank" to cut the Instro Sequence (Tum...... Tum Tum.....)

[/color][/size][/font][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=1]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/size][/color][/font]
[center]
[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655282.png[/img][font=Comic Sans MS][size=3][color=#b6b6b6][/color][/size][/font][/center][font=Comic Sans MS][size=3][color=#b6b6b6]

[/color][/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]If you're in need of [color=#1e84cc]performance[/color], here are some tips to gain [color=#1e84cc]FPS[/color]:[/size][/color][/font]
[/list][list=1]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]Go to Skyrim Launcher, Options, Advanced, View Distance, and Enable "Object Detail Fade";[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][font=Comic Sans MS][size=3]Go to Skyrim Launcher, Options,[/size][/font] and Disables both Antialiasing and Anistropic Filtering, then Configure both on the Graphics Driver from your GPU;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]Put Anistropic Filtering to the maximum of 8x, as there is no noticeable diference putting a value higher;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]Totally disable Antialiasing, IT WILL IMPROVE a LOT your FPS, but if you still want it, put it on the maximum 2x;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]I recommend you to SWAP Antialiasing by FXAA, it does better and increases performance in comparison to antialiasing;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]Play on the Resolution of your monitor ALWAYS;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]Do not play on windowed mode, instead enable Fullscreen or use a mod to enable Fake Fullscreen (Fake Fullscreen increases performance)[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]Try to drecrease the brightness in-game, it improves quality a little (Brightness in-game does not work in Fake-Fullscreen, instead, tweak by external means eg.: monitor, drivers, Windows)[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]Decreasing the shadows quality is the best way to gain more FPS, Ram, V-Ram and overall performance;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]Always use SKSE with his .ini properly configured, you will have more stability and performance;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=https://www.google.com.br/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&ved=0ahUKEwiO-tL-9o7MAhXHjZAKHZQDAKQQFggdMAA&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.geforce.com%2Fwhats-new%2Fguides%2Fthe-elder-scrolls-v-skyrim-tweak-guide&usg=AFQjCNHlCmu0zaCiwhfry0sBQHYd6wd8mA&sig2=rp15-VX7_AdgapAQeO499w&cad=rja]The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Tweak Guide[/url]: Follow this guide to help you tweak a lot of options and configurations of your game;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]Do not install too many mods (principly [color=#1e84cc]scripted[/color] ones), it's very hard to maintain a stable game;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]The Plugin limit is of 256 plugins (not mods), so be careful;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]If that dosen't help you, I recommend you to use ENBoost, it's like SKSE, but it does different things to help you with stability and performance, go here: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/73618/]Crash fix ENBoost[/url].[/size][/color][/font]

[/list][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=1]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/size][/color][/font]
[center]
[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655296.png[/img][color=#b6b6b6][/color][/center][color=#b6b6b6]

[/color][list]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]I Recommend you to install most of these famous mods like SkyUI and USLEEP, like these listed bellow:[/size][/color][/font]
[/list][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]
[/size][/color][/font][list=1]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3863/]SkyUI[/url] for a PC Interface, and not vanilla console interface;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71214/]Unofficial Skyrim Legendary Edition Patch[/url] for a lot of bug fixing;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/31255/]Unofficial High Resolution Patch[/url] for a lot of bug fixing IF you use the Oficial HiRes DLC's;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/47327]Cutting Room Floor[/url] for restoration of cut content;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/23390/]Guard Dialogue Overhaul[/url] for guards dialogue fixes;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/60637/]Improved Hearthfire Lighting[/url] for fixing of Hearthfire DLC homes lightning;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51038/]SKSE ini pre-download for lazy users[/url] for the .ini of the SKSE;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/44596/]Mfg Console[/url] for a better console command and fix for character eye blink;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/40564/]SkyFalls and SkyMills[/url] for functional waterfalls at distance and realistic mills;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/70656/]Wiseman303's Flora Fixes[/url] for fixes bugs relating to harvestable objects in Skyrim, including the Flora Respawn Bug;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55100/]Wiseman303's Trap Fixes[/url] for fixes to numerous issues with traps in Skyrim;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54485/]Wiseman303's Critter Fixes[/url] for fixes with insects and other things related;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54891]Wiseman303's Evasive Chickens[/url] this mod makes chickens get out of the way;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52296/]Unique Border Gates[/url] to complement the "disable invisible border" .ini tweak;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56980/]VioLens - A Killmove Mod[/url] for fixing and new killmoves;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/73937/]Vivid Weathers[/url] for a more diversified weather;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51199/]vwr Wet Eyes[/url] for wet eyes "blur" effect after dipped in water;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/64941/]Wonders of Weather[/url] for various weathers effects like rain impact splash;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27563/]Wet and Cold[/url] for effects bettwen characters and weathers like wetness state, goin home when the rain starts;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]If you have a good machine (don't need to be THAT good), you can install [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59721/]DynDOLOD[/url] for a better view distance (never tweak uGridsToLoad, it causes instability.)[/size][/color][/font]
[/list][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=1]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/size][/color][/font]
[center]
[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4656037.png[/img][/center]

[list]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]There areÂ  a lot of guides out there, principly for Skyrim, you can use them if you wish, but they're are a lot more bigger than mine, so if you're in a hurry or want a more "lightweight guide", this is the place, otherwise you can go in these guides like [url=http://wiki.step-project.com/]S.T.E.P[/url] or any other guide avaliable on Nexus.[/size][/color][/font]
[/list]

[font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=1]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/size][/color][/font][color=#b6b6b6][center][img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655314.png[/img][font=Comic Sans MS][size=3][/size][/font][/center][font=Comic Sans MS][size=3]

[/size][/font][/color][list]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]There are a lot of mods on the Nexus that can enhance your game in different ways, like those bellow:[/size][/color][/font]
[/list][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]
[/size][/color][/font][list=1]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]The [url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]Skyrim Script Extender (SKSE)[/url] itselft;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=https://www.google.com.br/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=2&ved=0ahUKEwivwtTz4I7MAhUKHZAKHTjvBdwQFgglMAE&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fmods%2F20773&usg=AFQjCNEP3pMC63lL00I-vC42bcYFZYbWsw&sig2=i76S9RurDdLzaWOVtgCVfw&cad=rja]Smaller Kingthings Petrock fonts[/url], this mod changes the whole game font with a new one that fits better in the atmosphere (use the regular version);[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/33395/]SkyTweak[/url], so you can edit most of the .ini's in game and a lot of other options;[/size][/color][/font]

[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/12801]Optimizer Textures[color=#b6b6b6] [/color][/url]for optimizing BSA's and textures of Skyrim, DLC's and mods;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=https://www.google.com.br/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&ved=0ahUKEwiQwu7x447MAhVFfpAKHRfWAdQQFggcMAA&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fmods%2F1840&usg=AFQjCNG0fBK-QJXDVfy2jH1MaSwwt72weg&sig2=rPNGMlHbhmiB359wnCfxYg&bvm=bv.119408272,d.Y2I&cad=rja]Wrye Bash[/url], it makes more mods compatible with each other by importing information from different mods into a "bashed patch";[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=https://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url] for load order plugins sorting, but it dosen't make magic, you have to read the Description page of all mods to see the best load order individually;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/]TES5Edit[/url] can be used in a basic way, for cleaning mods, a [url=https://www.google.com.br/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&ved=0ahUKEwjwyo3x5I7MAhUBiJAKHcMQDhsQFggcMAA&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.creationkit.com%2FTES5Edit_Cleaning_Guide_-_TES5Edit&usg=AFQjCNHOJD7CaAkYQY6k4vkEWu6GKAF7NQ&sig2=o4ChRUAXCDlgV8pmFu7jWQ&bvm=bv.119408272,d.Y2I&cad=rja]TES5Edit Cleaning Guide[/url] is avaliable for tutorial;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/modmanager/]NMM[color=#b6b6b6], the Nexus Mod Manager for installing mods.[/color][/url][/size][/color][/font]

[/list][list]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]Post scriptum: Always check the compatibility of one mod with the other one, maybe you will need a "compatibility patch" for better stability.[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]For a [color=#1e84cc]list[/color] of "unsafe" mods, go to [url=https://www.reddit.com/r/skyrimmods/wiki/dangerous_mods_masterlist]dangerous_mods_masterlist[/url].[/size][/color][/font]
[/list][right]
[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655333.png[/img][/right]

[font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=1]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/size][/color][/font]

[center]
[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655401.png[/img][/center]


[list]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]You should Read the whole [color=#1e84cc]Description[/color] page, if you want to tweaks the .ini's, you need to open your Skyrim.ini and SkyrimPrefs.ini inside the My Games (Documents) folder, and then go adding (or swaping) the values of the tweaks based on what you want or like, it's best to edit it using Notepad++;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]To configure the overall options of the game, go to the Options of the Skyrim Launcher;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]To install the mentioned mods, follow the link and there you will know how to install individual mods;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]You don't need to download anything from here, but if you want, the Download Section have the Main File, in wich is the Description page itselft unfluffed, the Read-me, and my own Skyrim.ini and SkyrimPrefs.ini;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]The Files in the Download Section are Read-Only, if you want to edit-it, deselect this option.[/size][/color][/font]
[/list] [center]

[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4656624.png[/img][/center]

[list]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]For a [color=#1e84cc]total regression[/color] (if you didn't made a back-up of your .ini's, you must first make sure that the "SkyrimPrefs.ini" found inside the "Skyrim Folder Itself" (Steam>blahblahblah>TESVSkyrim>Skyrim>SkyrimPrefs.ini) is intact, otherwise, only the reinstallation of the game will fix your .ini's;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]Now, go to the .ini's found in your Documents>My Games>Skyrim folder, and [Delete] the "Skyrim.ini" and the "SkyrimPrefs.ini" files;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]After that, start the game by the original Skyrim launcher (not SKSE), and re-choose your preferred options, then start the game once;[/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]Now you have your [color=#1e84cc]vanilla .ini's.[/color][/size][/color][/font]
[/list] [center]
[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655403.png[/img][/center]
[list]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]This "mod" is compatible with[color=#1e84cc] everything[color=#ffffff],[/color][/color] but be carefull in tweaking the options and configurations of your game, because you can make your computer melt down, making your house be burned down because the "high settings" and a "weak Hardware". Or you could edit your game in a Wrong way, destroying him and forcing yourself to reinstall the game.[/size][/color][/font]
[/list]

[center]
[img]http://images.cooltext.com/4655351.png[/img][/center]

[list]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3]This "guide" is mostly a brief compilation of useful tweaks and tips found everywere, so if you want to creat a guide with my guide as a base or any other thing, you are [color=#1e84cc]free[/color] to do it, just give me credits.[/size][/color][/font]
[/list][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=1]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[/size][/color][/font][center][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=1]

[/size][/color][/font]
[list]
[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][color=#1e84cc]Nexus mods and Community[/color] for everything![/size][/color][/font]
[/list][list]

[*][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#b6b6b6][size=3][color=#1e84cc]All of the Users (and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/2093220]Valorien[/url] for the shadow tweaks)[/color] for helping me and [color=#1e84cc]Mod Authors[/color] for all of the mods and my own personal mods profile;[/size][/color][/font]
